text:
Emergency tests, exercises conducted by Makkah Metro prior to Hajj commencement Published on : Wednesday, September 9, 2015
In order to be ready to face any untoward incidents on Wukuf Day, various emergency management tests and exercises are being conducted by Makkah Metro, said Makkah Metro train operator, Prasarana Malaysia Berhad.
“The exercise involves various scenarios, from unopened door issue to system failure and fire at station, and the workers are trained to manage the situation to ensure as little impact as possible,” he told reporters in Makkah.
The Al Mashaaer Al Mugadassah Makkah Metro train service, which will operate around the clock for seven days from 7 Zulhijjah (Sept 21) to 13 Zulhijjah, will be transporting over two million haj pilgrims between Mina, Muzdalifah and Arafah, which are the among the locations to perform the prescribed rituals of the Haj.
The Arafah 1, Arafah 2, Arafah 3, Mudzalifah 1, Mudzalifah 2, Mudzalifah 3, Mina 1, Mina 2 and Mina 3 (Jamarat) stations will have double-layer platform doors to control entry of pilgrims into the train.
As such, he said quick response by the workers was vital as even a tiny incident could hamper the smooth running of the train operation.
There will also be a special waiting area between the two platform doors before the pilgrims can get on the train.
